jcr:content.jcr:description: Paris, October 1st, 2015 - At the Banking & Innovation trade show held October 1st, Worldline [Euronext: WLN] won a top Banking & Innovation prize for its "Digital Assistant" solution. Worldline provides a digital assistant that can support customers in their everyday lives via a mobile banking app with advice tailored to their profile.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline wins Banking & Innovation prize for its "Digital Assistant"
jcr:content.keywords: worldline, banking and Innovation prize, digital assistant

richtext.text:
Paris, October 1st, 2015 - At the Banking & Innovation trade show held October 1st, Worldline [Euronext: WLN] won a top Banking & Innovation prize for its "Digital Assistant" solution. Worldline provides a digital assistant that can support customers in their everyday lives via a mobile banking app with advice tailored to their profile.

Backed by our digital platform, the Digital Assistant detects user internet actions by linking customer profiles to context - i.e. smartphone location, internet browsing etc. - in order to give customers relevant assistance at the right time on all mobile devices including cellphones, tablets and smartwatches. Assistance may come in the form of an immediate response to an application for funds or a partner offering based on shopping plans.

As driver of high-tech banking web initiatives, Worldline provides banks latest-technology services including multichannel, wallet, mobile banking, context-based services, big data, Personal Finance Management etc, to build even closer relationships with customers.

Banks can thus occupy a privileged place on the mobile channel with innovative digital services tailored to the context of use of each of their client for mobile banking even more proactive and intuitive.

Benoit Couchon, product manager Digital Banking Worldline: "Digital Assistant fully fits with Worldline's innovative strategy. New uses will emerge, such as the integration of the digital bank in personal digital and mobile assistant. Worldline continues to invest in these solutions to support banks in the long time, bringing them constantly new competitive assets to face all the challenges and opportunities of the digital transformation."

About Worldline

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. Worldline employs more than 7,300 people worldwide and generated 1.15 billion euros revenues in 2014.
Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com

About Banking & Innovation Prizes

Banking & Innovation Prizes reward innovation and developments of companies producing goods or services directly related to banking innovation. The prizes are selected by a jury consisting of a trade team and a journalist team.
